title: Snowpiercer movie title typeface
content:
Howdy!

Watched Snowpiercer last night and loved the super tracked out geometric sans serif they were using in the title sequence. It looks a lot like Neutraface 2 to me, but appears more extended (particularly the W and the S). Any ideas?

[http://title-sequence.tumblr.com/image/81284171693](http://web.archive.org/web/20150404063915/http:/title-sequence.tumblr.com/image/81284171693)

Thanks!
author: mauschen

comments.content:
This one caught my attention but I guess without a better sample, it'll be hard to identify it. A way would be to directly ask [Sangdon Lee](http://web.archive.org/web/20150404063915/http:/www.behance.net/gallery/Snowpiercer-title-sequence/15689859) and if he answer, drop it here as well.  
Alternatives so far: [Milano MTT](http://web.archive.org/web/20150404063915/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/mtt/milano), [CityOf](http://web.archive.org/web/20150404063915/http:/www.railfonts.com/cgi-bin/font_shop/fontshop.cgi?ACTION=enter&thispage=page10.html), [Arquitecta](http://web.archive.org/web/20150404063915/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/latinotype/arquitecta), [Leto Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150404063915/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/glen-jan/leto-sans)
Actually, now I think it's [Telegrafico](http://web.archive.org/web/20150404063915/http:/www.dafont.com/telegrafico.font) with a custom /S (borrowed elsewhere?).
